page.title: 04Belfairs Reserve:Management.
page.content: The Great Wood and Dodds Grove are managed by Southend-on-Sea Borough Concil as a{Nature Reserve}.Sixteen hectares was purchased in 1937 and a further 21 ha. in 1946, mainly as a result of pressure from the South-East Essex Natural History Society. Coppicing of the Great Wood was resumed 15 years ago as a means of improving habitats for wild-life. About 2 ha. is coppiced annually under a 20 year cycle. Some coppiced poles are used by the Parks Dept. but most are sold under contract to timber firms. The warden also undertakes path improvement, nesting site provision and educational work with the help of council workers, government work schemes and volunteers.
